alert.note: Alert for Luce; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 18 at 3:16PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, strongest near Lake Superior creasting blowing snow. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow with up to 2 inches this afternoon. * WHERE...Luce and Southern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from midnight tonight to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is the potential for near blizzard conditions after midnight tonight across Luce County. Travelers should remain vigilant for future forecasts and plan on extra time to reach their destination or consider adjusting their travel plans.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
